gcci.text: With H100 average prices still around $3.17/hr, hyperscalers are pushing diversified sourcing to de-risk supply, while capex remains elevated but front-loaded into co-location and vertically integrated chips to secure availability.

gtpi.text: DeepSeek's aggressive pricing at ~$1.25 per 1M input tokens is accelerating API price wars and shifting value to efficiency; inference-optimized models and prompt compression are becoming key competitive levers.

gagl.text: Kimi projects a 120 TWh annual AI load heightening grid strain; siting near baseload/nuclear and deploying demand-response and storage will be essential to keep power cheap and carbon intensity low.

aipi.text: GLM notes the AI buildout is structurally strong, but fast capex cycles and compressing margins point to bubble risk unless new revenue models and hardware/utilities synergies sustain growth.
